result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert K. Court

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on February 22, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 27, 2023 at 11:00 am.

11:26 AM case called. Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert K. Court in court with Attorney David Field. Hearing today is to discuss letter filed by the Defendant requesting new representation. Defendant notes reasons for request. 

Court denies request and notes reasoning. Court discusses Defendants option to retain private counsel. 

Matter is to be put on trial calendar for 2 days. Counsel is to contact Branch 2 Judicial Assistance for further scheduling.
Dated 09/13/2022, Letter from Court to defendant regarding request for new Court Appointed Attorney.

Dated 08/26/2022, Letter from Defendant requesting a new Court Appointed Attorney.
Filed via counter; copies given to all parties.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:31 AM case called. Defendant Robert K. Court in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Robert K. Court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. 
Defense requests a status conference. 
A status conference is scheduled for 9/30/22 at 11:15 AM.

Attorney David Field at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 08/12/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(Case called at 10:44 AM) Defendant Robert K. Court in court without counsel.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State recites the offer by the State and indicates that the Defendant had previously declined the offer and requested the case be scheduled for trial. Defendant agrees. 
Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to an attorney. Defendant intends to apply for a county appointed attorney. Court to schedule case for one last Status Conference before scheduling for trial- giving the Defendant time to get counsel. Discussion held regarding types of trials.  
Status Conference: 08/19/2022 at 11:30 AM.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert K. Court in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Not guilty pleas entered and accepted. Case referred to Br. 2 for scheduling.
CK 43956 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail refunded.

Conditions:
No contact with K.W. or her residence, C.M., R.V. or their residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party.

Judge Jon Theisen for Branch 2 Intake. 
Case called at 11:23 AM.
Defendant Robert K. Court in court without counsel.  Attorney Tiffany Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/6/22 at 3:00 PM.
RTN: 6/27/22 at 9:30 AM.
